website_summaries.verdict: With unrivaled comfort features, reliable support, and discreet design, this premium maternity belt covers all the bases.
pros: Extra soft and comfortable with no hard edges, bumps, or lumps
Below-the-belly design is less noticeable under clothing
Stretches and conforms to your shape for customized support
Provides back, hip, and abdominal support
Built-in pouch with hot/cold gel pack is a nice touch
cons: Some issues with the Velcro straps losing grip after a while

customer_reviews.title: Mine lasted about 5 weeks :(
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews but I'm super bummed about this product. I absolutely loved it for the first month and it helped my low back pain. But then the Velcro stopped working. I've only washed it twice on cold water and hung to dry...so I think mine is defective? Anyway because it's been more than 30 days since I purchased, i called amazon and They said I can't get replacement band. At this much money I would expect the product to work through my entire pregnancy.
customer_reviews.author: OzzyBlue

customer_reviews.title: Great product, questionable/poor quality...be prepared to buy +1
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this product, started wearing at 16 weeks 6-7 days a week. I have only had it for 2 months though and the edges are totally frayed and now come undone...working on getting an exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Browder

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pregnancy and Post-Pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: This works well for lower back pain during pregnancy and as an abdominal binder post-pregnancy! I was able to wear it for about a week after delivering but then it didn't quite fit my curves and was leaving gaps. One negative about this is it tends to ride up when you're sitting, but I'm not sure that anything could be done about it. I love the pocket that it has and that it comes with a heating/cooling pad! This feels high quality and I was comfortable washing it on gentle cycle and laying flat to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Alicein Wonderland

customer_reviews.title: but based on trying it on it seems really easy to put on with great support
customer_reviews.text: This review is for sizing reference. I’m 28 weeks and my belly currently measures 41” and my hips 42”. I ordered size Medium based on the product description and even double checked on the brand’s website. Way too small! I could barely get the ends to meet securely. There’s no way this size would last me the rest of my pregnancy. I am returning and ordering size Large. Since I didn’t get a chance to wear the belt I can’t comment on it’s function/comfort yet, but based on trying it on it seems really easy to put on with great support.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleGal

customer_reviews.title: A must-have!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 22 weeks pregnant with my second child. I'm not sure how I survived my first pregnancy without this! It is such a relief, not only for my back, but for my umbilical hernia that my first child gave me :). But honestly, it is SO worth the money. You won't regret this purchase. Just for sizing help- Pre-pregnancy I was 139 lbs, 5'6", and now I am about 149 lbs at 22 weeks pregnant, and the medium fits me perfectly. I believe it will definitely last throughout my entire pregnancy.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: The quality was great but it the fit wasn't great
customer_reviews.text: The quality was great but it the fit wasn't great. I'm 5'2.5" and have a short torso and I felt like the band was digging into my lower ribs. I ended up going with something a little bit more flexible that fit better,though the quality doesn't compare. I also recommend, which is good quality, affordable and lasts well though it didn't offer me the support of the Bracoo.
customer_reviews.author: Aliza HausmanTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last, not worth the exorbitant cost
customer_reviews.text: This worked pretty well at first. It does crease a lot which it says is for a better fit, but which I didn't really like. Then after about a week of wearing it, the bottom flap would slide up and stick out awkwardly after wearing it for about 5-10 minutes. This makes for a very awkward look under shirts or dresses and is kind of uncomfortable. I just don't see why this strap is $70. For the first week, it was slightly more supportive than the $20 one I also bought, but not $50 better. Now I use the cheap one instead and this one is going back.
customer_reviews.author: goodstuff

customer_reviews.title: Amazing feeling! Even helped a little with my heartburn!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Not sure how I managed without it after second trimester began. I wouldn't go past 30 weeks without one mamas! There are some that look similar and much cheaper but I didn't want to risk it not being as good. Seemed to alleviate my severe heartburn/reflux a little too being my problem. My back is actually fine but the front weight was killing me at 5ft tall. This makes you have a shelf for the baby instead of the pressure on you. Held my back up a little which is why I think it helped my heartburn some. This thing is amazing wish I knew to try it last time around!
customer_reviews.author: Harris Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I got this, I put it on and felt immediate relief for my pelvic and lower back pain. I don’t wear it all of the time because the consistent pressure bothers me after a while, but it definitely works well for me in moderation. It’s not going to cure all of your problems, but it does make a difference. The hot/cold pack is a great feature. Also, I’ve noticed I really do feel less inclined to pee wearing this, as it claims!
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus J.

customer_reviews.title: Did not take away my discomfort
customer_reviews.text: I thought for sure this would have taken away my pelvic pain that i was having from being pregnant. It didn’t! I was extremely disappointed. The band was very uncomfortable when sitting. I ultimately returned this product.
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: It was pretty big in the beginning
customer_reviews.text: This belly band has been my saving grace during my pregnancy. I'm 30 weeks and still running because of the support this gives me! I wear it when I run, lift weights or go for long walks. I can feel a big difference when I take it off, so I know the support is there! I usually wear a M in pants, and I ordered a M band. It was pretty big in the beginning, but the velcro area is big enough that it still worked. I'm glad I got the M because as I have grown, it still fits well with a little room to grow!
customer_reviews.author: Cari R

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even know I needed it
customer_reviews.text: Band works great- I'm 26 weeks and 39 inches in the belly and the size Medium fits perfectly (about halfway into the band size, so room to grow and shrink back). Put it on right out of the package and was immediately pleased- I hadn't even realized how much my back had been straining until it wasn't anymore! I don't wear it all day or at night, just in the evenings when the day is catching up to me and I start feeling fatigued.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Low quality velcro
customer_reviews.text: I got this at the end of my 2nd trimester and loved it! I hand washed it ONCE according to the directions and ever since then the velcro has not worked very well. Now at 38 weeks I can barely use it, I have to make it very tight or else velcro comes undone right away. I feel for the price I paid, they should offer a much higher quality velcro that will actually work and hold the belt properly. In theory a good product but beware of the sucky velcro situation.
customer_reviews.author: Carina M

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: I was really on the fence about purchasing this product because there are cheaper ones out there, but you can not beat the convenience of a one-piece band. It really helps me feel supported during pregnancy and (I think) avoid injury as I exercise and lift my toddler. I am pleased that it has a back pocket for an ice/heat pack, and I look forward to flipping it around and trying it as a belly binder postpartum. Plus it's FSA/HSA-eligible! Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness, I love this band!! I'm not even very big(belly or weight-wise) and it still is such a relief! If you're around 20 weeks or more GET IT! You'll be pleased you did. Why be at all uncomfortable if you don't have to? I wore a size 4 before pregnancy and I'm 6 ft tall. Now that I'm pregnant I have to wear a size 6 in clothing because my breasts have gotten so big, but my tummy is not that big. I ordered a Medium in this belly band and it fits well and will fit me right up until the end. Lots of room to grow in it. Super soft and comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Swanwave

customer_reviews.title: Helped with sciatica pain during 3 trimester
customer_reviews.text: I developed really painful sciatica pain during my third trimester and my doctor recommended getting a support band. I immediately bought this one after looks at all the options on amazon. I am so happy that I chose this product. I wore it every day for three months and they held up beautifully. I wore it above a tank top because I found that the adhesive was too uncomfortable if I wore it against my skin, specially when I was sitting. I wore this every single day to help support my baby’s weight. It’s so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline_hikes

customer_reviews.title: Whether you're expecting to keep expecting, or in your 30th week, worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I am a size 8 pre-preg and 150#; 5'5"... I bought the small and I've got plenty of growth room. Also want to say this is pregnancy nr 5 and I am fairly young, but I've used A LOT of different support bands and this is BY FAR the best fit and support! Doesn't wrinkle, bend... yes, it's pricey, but whether you are expecting to be expecting again, or are in your 30th week, it's STILL TOTALLY WORTH IT! 💞
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Ok... I use it every once and awhile.
customer_reviews.text: My friend told me this was a must have pregnancy product. I like that the ice pack/ warm pack slips right into the band. I intend to use this in reverse after my c section as well. I only gave it four stars, because it's not a "miracle" band as some have touted, but helps from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great support, a bit bulky
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing in terms of support and relieving back pain, but is a bit bulky and not completely comfortable. I’m keeping it because no other bands I’ve tried compare to the support this provides, which is most important at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: kd

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money! I tried three different versions of a maternity belt, one very affordable option and one less expensive than this one and neither were near the quality or support of the belly bandit. This is worth the money for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Holtz

customer_reviews.title: It's alright, but maybe not $75 alright.
customer_reviews.text: Helps somewhat, but I'm not entirely sure it was worth the $75. It's uncomfortable to wear for long periods of time, and it shows under clothing. That said, it's really nice with the cool/warm pack in to help with aches and pains. I think $40ish is a more appropriate price point given the benefits this provides, so take that as you will.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Dudley

customer_reviews.title: Deceiving - not the correct product in the box
customer_reviews.text: I was Upset to open this product. It looked like it was not the product I ordered It was bad quality. It said made in China. It did not have the belly bandit logo anywhere and the material did not seem like the correct material. Basically it was a scam. I returned It.i forgot to add that it wasn’t even the color i ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen

customer_reviews.title: Expensive lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: Has helped with my back problems tremendously. My only complaints are that it seems overpriced for what it is, and it creases.
customer_reviews.author: Rp

customer_reviews.title: Amazing but does start to bunch up
customer_reviews.text: I wear this daily. It’s taken about a week and it’s started to bunch up quite a bit. I’m going to wash it and hope that helps because the support is awesome! I love that I can discreetly wear it under clothes and the ice pack is a huge bonus. I have 2 bulging discs, prior to pregnancy, and this has been a lifesaver for me.
customer_reviews.author: yogagirl13

customer_reviews.title: Wow! What a relief
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a relief this product is. I’m 7 months pregnant dealing w a ton a pain because I’m carrying my baby girl so low and this honestly takes off so much pressure from my lower belly and lower back! So thankful I found something to help!
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: A small fits good and the band has a lot of Velcro room ...
customer_reviews.text: This helps with back pain a lot. A small fits good and the band has a lot of Velcro room on either side to be smaller or larger so I anticipate it will fit throughout my pregnancy and post-partum. I'm 5'6" and was about 125 lbs pre-pregnancy and am now about 140 lbs at 29 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: LLS

customer_reviews.title: Helps with Feeling of Pressure
customer_reviews.text: I am 34 weeks pregnant and I bought this a few weeks ago. I used it occasionally but not regularly. Yesterday I was feeling more pressure than usual so I put the band on and it really helped. I thought it was a bit pricey but if it works then it is worth it. As for comfort, I have worn belly bands post-delivery before and it is basically the same thing. At this point I don't care if you can tell I am wearing this Upsie Belly Band, there is no hiding the fact I am prego and being comfortable is most important right now.
customer_reviews.author: A. O'C

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver at 35 weeks!
customer_reviews.text: I'm about 5'2", now weighing about 132 lbs, with a 40 inch baby bump. I bought a Medium, based off the size chart, and the Belly Bandit Upsie has been so comfortable and supporting at the tail end of my pregnancy! I've been wearing this on my walks and sleeping without it on and it's been very helpful. Highly recommend for Mommy's!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! I wore a size 16 pant before pregnancy so the XL was a good start. It fits at its tightest but I’m only 22 weeks, so I have room to grow. Love the hot/cold pack
customer_reviews.author: ladyb123

customer_reviews.title: I've worn it through three pregancies and gifted two!
customer_reviews.text: This product is reliable, durable and effective at alleviating the "weight" of a pregnant belly in the last trimester (or earlier, if its not your first pregnancy). Helps maintain the beauty of your skin as well as the health of your spine & muscles. It is also, by far, the most comfortable and easy to take care of, plus, the ice pack is handy far beyond the use during pregnancy. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: VVgypsyVV

customer_reviews.title: Helped my back pain
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help the back pain I had while carrying my daughter. Helped to reduce the pain and increase my ability to do more while pregnant. It’s easy to wash and comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.author: Erin OHern

customer_reviews.title: Good support
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter and she gave great reviews that this has helped her with the back pain she was experiencing.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This is such a great support belt. I had a cheap one I was using and it doesn’t compare. I’m 5ft and pregnant with twins at 22wks and got a Medium. My belly is already really heavy and I’m trying to keep pressure off my cervix. I’ve worn it over clothes and under clothes. I read other people had problems sitting but it still feels perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: craig butterman’s wife

customer_reviews.title: This is the one to get!
customer_reviews.text: I hate to say it because they’re pricey, but this is the one to get! Works perfect for my wife
customer_reviews.author: Carl Becker

customer_reviews.title: It actually encourages good posture. I spend the majority of my 12 ...
customer_reviews.text: The upsie belly helps support my growing belly while I'm walking and standing. It actually encourages good posture. I spend the majority of my 12 hour work day on my feet. While I'm up and about its great. It's very uncomfortable while sitting. It digs into my pubic bone. I'm short waisted, so maybe that is why. The first day I wore it for 12 hrs. When I came home and took it off, my pubic bone was sore and bruised. But, my uterus felt good, not achey or tired. So now, I take it off when I sit down at work. That seems to help.
customer_reviews.author: KAO

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: This was the most uncomfortable thing I have tried in my pregnancy. I tried to wear it once, the evening I received it, and my back was hurting within 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: CJB

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay fastened - Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: I started wearing this item in February and now mid-May the velcro on the white band does not stay fastened. I'm very disappointed in the amount of money spent on this item for it to unfasten at random times.
customer_reviews.author: KTH

customer_reviews.title: Missing hot/cold pack
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good band but the hot/cold pack is not included like they said in the description. It’s a disappointment because it’s such an expensive band but still missing parts.
customer_reviews.author: Max Quach

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this comfortable pregnancy belt
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these - one in a small (for second trimester) and one in a medium (for third trimester) - and I LOVE them. The first time I put one on, I knew I had to buy it because it eased the discomfort of pregnancy right away. I wear them around the clock, and it's helped make my pregnancy much less painful.
customer_reviews.author: EditorMe

customer_reviews.title: Just as expected
customer_reviews.text: Speedy delivery, no problems with the quality of the material so far. After wearing for a couple hours, my belly needs a break from the support - or I need to readjust how tight it is around below my belly. Otherwise provides good support so far. Still trialing it out while at work.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good but wish it were less expensive
customer_reviews.text: The bamboo material is great (even in summer). The fit works. My only complaint is that the velcro part cuts into my belly if I don't have a skirt / shorts that foldover the top part (I'm in my third trimester). It's more comfortable for standing and walking, not as much for sitting. Still a good product-- just wish it were less expensive!
customer_reviews.author: jiahahn

customer_reviews.title: Supportive
customer_reviews.text: good product, helped the wife a lot, but the velcro wears out fairly quickly
customer_reviews.author: Crow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: such a big help for my back and stomach, especially recently. I've just reached 36 weeks and my pelvis is really uncomfortable. I LOVE that this has an ice pack that I can use to sooth the pain.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsti Sinden

customer_reviews.title: Helps a lot with pain
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think I would use this much outside of work but after wearing it around the house when it arrived I could tell the difference in how i felt and my posture when I took it off. Now I wear it all the time. I used the sizing chart off the belly bandit website to decide which size to order and it fits very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mekenna

customer_reviews.title: Provides comfortable support - saves my bladder!
customer_reviews.text: This provides a nice "lift" alleviating the pressure on my bladder and helping me sit up straight so as not to strain my back. It fits comfortably under all of my clothes. When I wear it I actually see a distinct difference in how I am carrying my belly compared to when it's removed. Sounds pretty obvious, but you'll see for yourselves. I'm even contemplating wearing it to bed! I got this at around 34 weeks and imagine it will become increasingly indispensable these last few weeks of my pregnancy and hopefully beyond.
customer_reviews.author: EczemaMamma

customer_reviews.title: A good idea for some things!
customer_reviews.text: I did a 5k walk in this belt and it took some strain off my back. For all day use I can't see it can be a little much and I want my back to continue to do the work of carrying these babes!
customer_reviews.author: Niferr

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable at all
customer_reviews.text: Not comfortable at all. I don't know if it's too small or too big but it moves around and only gives support for about 10 min. I am a nurse and move around a lot so this did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: I use this product to support an abdominal hernia.
customer_reviews.text: I actually use this product to support an abdominal hernia. The way this product is design with its tapered shape provides the extra support in only the area that I need it. It's black so it's discreet under clothes. It's smooth rounded edges don't cut into your skin. The fabric has a felt finish that's comfortable. The fabric is thicker than I imagined but it supports beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: bunkqueena

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This was a NEED during my pregnancy, and it even helps post pregnancy as well. It was expensive, but worth it to help my back pain and growing belly during pregnancy
customer_reviews.author: Abc

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked better for c-section recovery than for maternity support. Was too large.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: lost stickiness in 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: the belt was great initially but it lost its stickiness after 2 weeks of use. I haven't washed it so it would have nothing to do with washing. Don't buy if you need a belt for longer than 2 weeks. (I'm going to return it)
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: GREAT RELIEF!
customer_reviews.text: OK Ladies, I never write reviews but after the relief I got when I put this on I just have to spread the news. I am 22 weeks with Twins and thought I should purchase a Large to be on the safe side. I am 5'6 and was 140lbs pre pregnancy. I am currently 155 lbs and If I had bought the Medium I would have been fine. With the Large I have a lot of room to grown into (I won't have to purchase another one because I won't out grow it). I hope this helps with sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Price

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This belly band is seriously amazing. I purchased at 20 weeks pregnant and as soon as I put it on I had instant relief in my abs. I have been wearing this to workout since!
customer_reviews.author: Linsey B

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure this will work great but I'm normally a size 6-8 and I am ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this will work great but I'm normally a size 6-8 and I am not sure why I bought a Large. I'm only 25 weeks, I'm sure i'll be able to use this in my third trimester, I hope! very comfy! love how the strap goes right underneath my belly.
customer_reviews.author: Alba

customer_reviews.title: ... try a friends cheaper one that was also really good but I am happy with this one
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant because of the price and I did try a friends cheaper one that was also really good but I am happy with this one. It makes a big difference for my back pain. I am 5 2" currently 160lb at 36.5 weeks and the one I bought was medium. It would fit someone larger too. There is a sizing image to the far left of the page, use that not the 'size chart' that is directly below the price.
customer_reviews.author: Wnela-Jane

customer_reviews.title: Better WITHOUT this thing.
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks. It is NOT comfortable. Every time you want to sit down, it cuts into your bladder. It seems like it takes some pressure off while standing, but not enough to make it worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Mindi

customer_reviews.title: but overall it's a great product, I really recommend
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely necessary for women in their third trimester. This is helping me soo much with back, pelvic and belly pain. I can get what others are saying about this folding over when you sit down (kind of annoying), but overall it's a great product, I really recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Saad and Madeline Saeed

customer_reviews.title: Such a huge help for pelvic pain!
customer_reviews.text: I started having severe pelvic pressure and back pain around 32 weeks pregnant. I was in agony! I found this belt and it has helped immensely. I wear it all day!
customer_reviews.author: Shameka B.

customer_reviews.title: best money i ever spent
customer_reviews.text: pregnant with twins here and i purchased this at 17 weeks pregnant, it does wonders for my back.
customer_reviews.author: TA101

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd belly band I have tried in the last month and a half. This was the best one out of all 3 but was very uncomfortable. It stopped my pelvis pain but the Velcro kept poking me so it was very uncomfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Leandra Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Great but missing hot/cold pack
customer_reviews.text: I love the band, but they did not send the hot and cold pack with it!
customer_reviews.author: Thirtyone consultant

customer_reviews.title: Immediate Relief
customer_reviews.text: This was a saving grace for me during my pregnancy. The minute I put it on, I felt immediate relief. Back pain was eliminated, and the support helped my hips as well. I would recommend this to anyone who is pregnant. I didn't realize how much I needed it until I tried it!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Heder

customer_reviews.title: The compression is good but the belt is kind of flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The compression is good but the belt is kind of flimsy. I also don't like how wide the front part is. It presses into my legs when I sit.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife... she is on her feet most all of her workday and it's provides her a lot of back pain relief. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: bz6039

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The BEST for extra support and back pain. 100% worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie L. Rea

customer_reviews.title: I'm in the last trimester of my second pregnant and ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm in the last trimester of my second pregnant and my back and sciatica have been killing me. This has been a LIFESAVER. Make sure you measure yourself on the website to ensure you get the right size. I'm 5'5", 30 weeks pregnant, and my belly is 42 inches around. I'm a size medium. This is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: A. E. Sevold

customer_reviews.title: Love that the material is so soft
customer_reviews.text: Gives the support I need for my growing tummy. Love that the material is so soft. I tend to get warm easily and sweat but the belly bandit isn’t warm to wear at all. I’ve been really pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Ozmun

customer_reviews.title: Helpful throughout the pregnancy.
customer_reviews.text: Truly helped throughout the pregnancy. Many reviews talked about disliking the product because you had to remove the belt in order to go to the bathroom, but I found a way to install it inside of my clothes so that I didn't have that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Higgins

customer_reviews.title: ... bigger and heavier but right now it's doing a good job at supporting my back and relieving low back ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm 7 months along so we'll see how this works when my belly is bigger and heavier but right now it's doing a good job at supporting my back and relieving low back aches and pains.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Helped Keep My Scrubs From Falling
customer_reviews.text: I was in medical training during my twin pregnancy and had to be on my feet a LOT. This provided support and comfort. I was also surprised to discover it provided a good place for me to tuck my scrubs in place without the uncomfortable sensation of a tight string around my belly!
customer_reviews.author: E.B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for support
customer_reviews.text: I cant wear it for more than 30 mins at a time because little man does not like the pressure/ support in his space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: You really notice the support once you take it off! Pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... was a size 4 pre pregnancy and this fits perfect and offers a lot of support
customer_reviews.text: I was a size 4 pre pregnancy and this fits perfect and offers a lot of support. I'm a teacher and this is my second pregnancy. I wouldn't be able to make it through the day standing without it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: wore a 12/14 pre pregnancy (and am 5'7). in ...
customer_reviews.text: wore a 12/14 pre pregnancy (and am 5'7). in 6th month of pregnancy, already gained 40 pounds, so I thought I'd go with the XL based on the size chart. It is starting to stretch out a lot after only about 5 wears, and it's not as supportive as a result. I guess I should have gotten the L...
customer_reviews.author: ctc

customer_reviews.title: It's comfortable and gives great support
customer_reviews.text: I would not be able to walk the dogs around the block without this product! It's comfortable and gives great support. Seriously, a back saver!
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Love the heat That it comes with as well
customer_reviews.text: This thing saved my life both during my pregnancy and postpartum. Compression help me return to my prepregnancy size within about a week! Love the heat That it comes with as well.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Fits nicely, doesn't show under snug clothes (not tight)
customer_reviews.text: Fits nicely, doesn't show under snug clothes (not tight). Completely resolved my pelvic pain though only moderately helps lower back pain. I do appreciate that it helps me during my dog walking so I don't have to use the bathroom every 5 minutes!
customer_reviews.author: Caity

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Velcro
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, after having the item replaced, same issue. After not even a week the velcro doesn’t stick. It’s a shame because when it works it offers great support. The velcro they use to make it is just super cheap. It won’t stay together.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Montag

customer_reviews.title: As a mom carrying twin babies, this product is ...
customer_reviews.text: As a mom carrying twin babies, this product is a lifesaver. The gives me extra support to relieve my back. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Romero

customer_reviews.title: My friend highly recommended this.
customer_reviews.text: My friend highly recommended this..however, i found it uncomfortable and my baby didn't seem to like it during the pregnancy. But, it may have been because she was already so low (head down) that it was putting pressure on her. Even loosening it didn't seem to help.
customer_reviews.author: AG1203

customer_reviews.title: Grea product
customer_reviews.text: I just received the Upsie, but so far it is great. I can walk a little faster and without the lower back pain. The swelling in my feet and legs went down. Definitely, appreciate the support it gives and the icepack Is genius
customer_reviews.author: J P

customer_reviews.title: Great for twin pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: Being small framed and pregnant with (larger) twins, this really helped ease pain on my back and hips when I was standing for any length of time. I got big so quickly I wore this for several months.
customer_reviews.author: KatieOz

customer_reviews.title: Used...be careful
customer_reviews.text: When I got mine you can clearly tell it's been used. I paid 60 bucks for a new one so I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: TAMMY

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra $ over store brands
customer_reviews.text: I used a cheaper baby store brand with my last pregnancy and liked it alright, but gave it to a friend. I "splurged" for this one and it is worth every extra penny. It is so much more comfortable and I LOVE the hot/cold pack feature.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Stoneman Walker

customer_reviews.title: Miracle for pubic symphysis pain
customer_reviews.text: This helped me so much! It relieved my pubic symphysis pain almost immediately! I wore it basically continuously (except in bed) for the last 2-3 months of my pregnancy
customer_reviews.author: BWS

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this to help with her sciatic pain and would highly recommend to all pregnant women who are experiencing the same. Helps with round ligament pain as well.
customer_reviews.author: slegs

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love this item!!! Best money I have spent to date. I was have lots of pressure in my abdomen and some back pain. Put this thing in and it provided almost immediate relief from both!
customer_reviews.author: Katelin Carson

customer_reviews.title: So, when pregnant women warn you about low back ...
customer_reviews.text: So, when pregnant women warn you about low back pain, they don't tell you about the raging sciatica... this helps with BOTH!!!
customer_reviews.author: SerendipityMA

customer_reviews.title: This product has obviously been used. The box was ...
customer_reviews.text: This product has obviously been used. The box was all taped together and open at the top. There is some sort of hair, maybe dog or cat, on the belt. Come on!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Amazing difference made with back pain reduction
customer_reviews.text: Amazing difference made with back pain reduction . I wish I didn't hold off for so long because of the price- it's worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable support belt I've tried on and the only one ...
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable support belt I've tried on and the only one I could wear all day. Also, I love that it comes with an ice pack that fits in the back - wonderful after a long day at work!
customer_reviews.author: ToddlerMom

customer_reviews.title: Only good when you're standing up
customer_reviews.text: I wish they made grooves for your legs to move around. If you sit down, it rides up and squeezes your belly. Not good
customer_reviews.author: Christy G

customer_reviews.title: Fits good. Like that you can wear it post baby
customer_reviews.text: Fits good. Like that you can wear it post baby. Like that it has a pouch and comes with a pack that you can felreeze or heat and insert in the pouch
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I had such bad hip pain with this pregnancy and this product definitely ...
customer_reviews.text: I had such bad hip pain with this pregnancy and this product definitely helped my pain from the constant up and down from my desk. My only complaint is that I wish I would have ordered a size bigger - it does run a little small. I could still use it, but it would have been better to have the extra support.
customer_reviews.author: LSmith89

customer_reviews.title: Still the best pregnancy support belt I have tried
customer_reviews.text: 2nd time to purchase this item coz this pregnancy this time around I am bigger. Still the best pregnancy support belt I have tried. It runs true to size so measure your belly first before ordering. It is suitable for humid Singapore where I perspire a lot coz it dries fast. I also use it after my CS.
customer_reviews.author: Aaminah Zarzuela

customer_reviews.title: Great quality Maternity belt
customer_reviews.text: This is a great maternity belt and made my back ache so much better when walking around and gave great support for my belly. The fabric is also really soft and comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: LH_30

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver during my third trimester. Wish I had this ...
customer_reviews.text: Lifesaver during my third trimester. Wish I had this during my first pregnancy, could have saved myself some aches and pains.
customer_reviews.author: Rose J. Morales

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this...material is super comfortable. I wore it starting about 4 or 5 months and still am wearing it at 9. Provides much needed support!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever for while I was pregnant
customer_reviews.text: Best thing ever for while I was pregnant. Took the pressure off my back so nice. I wore it all day. I recommend to anyone for second and third trimester
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: Bad back - life changing support!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few other belly bands and nothing compares. This is most importantly, soft supporting and even has a place for an ice pack. Absolutely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Fox

product_meta.title: Belly Bandit Upsie Belly Pregnancy Support Band - Black - Small
product_meta.description:
Size:Small| Color:Black

There's nothing more exciting than the journey to motherhood. But the strain of pregnancy on your body and back? Not so exciting. That's why we created the Upsie Belly pregnancy support band to help provide belly and back support where and when you need it most.


Why You'll Love It

Our popular Upsie Belly was designed to lift your belly, support your back, and stabilize your pelvic area, which can help:



-Ease back aches by redistributing belly weight and reducing the strain on your back muscles

-Soothe an aching back with included hot/cold gel pack

-Alleviate pelvic pain by limiting the mobility of your pelvic joints

-Relieve pressure on your bladder

-Increase postural stability, which can weaken during pregnancy as your center of gravity shifts

-Reduce discomfort during exercise
feature_bullets: 92% Bamboo from viscose 8% spandexcore - 75% Polyester 25% Spandex
Made with luxuriously soft viscose from bamboo
12" of adjustability to grow with your belly
Helps to ease sciatic, back & leg pain
